idx.auth.caption: Create an account below, then go to the Reviews page..
idx.auth.headline: Account for testers and reviewers
idx.brand.name: Measure Master
idx.cta.body: The app is currently in tester-only mode, but it is already usable for real-world jobs.  We are iterating based on feedback from people who actually work on site.
idx.cta.play: Get it on Google Play Store
idx.cta.sub: If you have trouble installing, please check the How to use page first.
idx.cta.title: Try measuring with just a photo.
idx.features.f1.body: Place a reference rectangle with known dimensions (for example, A4 paper). Using that, the app corrects perspective and estimates length and area on the photo.
idx.features.f1.title: Fix distortion with a reference rectangle
idx.features.f2.body: Trace straight or curved boundaries with your finger.  The app adds up total length and area for each shape and for the overall selection.
idx.features.f2.title: Measure complex outlines
idx.features.f3.body: The interface minimizes steps and button count so you can operate it quickly even when you are on site, wearing gloves, or in a hurry.
idx.features.f3.title: Designed for small screens and quick use
idx.features.lead: From photo perspective correction to curved line length, Measure Master focuses on the tools you actually use in the field.
idx.features.title: Key features
idx.hero.cta_play: Get it on Google Play Store in free
idx.hero.subtitle: AR, Photo Perspective, and On-screen.
idx.hero.tagline: Measure real-world distances, correct perspective in photos, and draw shapes directly on your screen — all in one place.
idx.hero.title: All-in-one measuring app
idx.limits.lead: Measure Master aims to bring the feel of “tape measure + field sense” into your phone. Please keep the following in mind.
idx.limits.li1: It targets approximate values for decision-making, not certified engineering-grade measurements.
idx.limits.li2: The more accurate your reference rectangle dimensions are, the more reliable the results will be.
idx.limits.li3: Camera angle, photo quality, and lens distortion can all introduce error.
idx.limits.li4: For legal or contractual measurements, you must still use proper professional tools and procedures.
idx.limits.title: About accuracy and limitations
idx.meta.description: Measure real-world distances, correct perspective in photos, and draw shapes directly on your screen — all in one place.
idx.meta.title: Measure Master
idx.modes.ar.body: Measure real-time distance between two points indoors using the AR camera.
idx.modes.ar.title: AR Mode
idx.modes.pm.body: Estimate the actual perimeter or area in a photo using a basic reference rectangle and perspective correction.
idx.modes.pm.title: Photo Perspective Mode
idx.modes.sm.body: Draw shapes directly on your screen and get approximate length and area immediately.
idx.modes.sm.title: On-screen Mode
idx.screens.lead: These screenshots are the same ones used on the Google Play listing.
idx.screens.s1.alt: Set up a reference rectangle, then measure lengths and areas in the corrected view.
idx.screens.s1.cap: Set up a reference rectangle, then measure lengths and areas in the corrected view.
idx.screens.s2.alt: Use AR mode to measure a segment directly in 3D space.
idx.screens.s2.cap: Use AR mode to measure a segment directly in 3D space.
idx.screens.s3.alt: Configure units, reference rectangle values, and other options before you measure.
idx.screens.s3.cap: Configure units, reference rectangle values, and other options before you measure.
idx.screens.title: Screenshots
idx.who.c1.body: Take one photo on site instead of drawing a quick sketch. As long as you include a known rectangle (like A4 paper), you can revisit the photo later and estimate lengths and areas.
idx.who.c1.title: Constructors and remodelers
idx.who.c2.body: When you just need to know “about how many square meters this is,”  trace the outline and see the approximate area on the spot.
idx.who.c2.title: Doors, windows, flooring, and more
idx.who.c3.body: Overlay measurements directly on the photo, capture the screen, and share it as a simple report with clients or colleagues.
idx.who.c3.title: Photos with dimensions on top
idx.who.lead: It’s optimized not for ultra-precise engineering work, but for fast decisions on site
idx.who.title: For whom  is Measure Master ?
htu_001: Step 1. Set Up Your Device (One-Time Setup)
htu_002: Before measuring, you need to calibrate your device once.
htu_003: Tap the Blue Eye icon, then tap the down arrow to open the Sub Menu Bar.
htu_004: Tap the screen twice to draw a straight line and measure it with a ruler.
htu_005: The displayed length will not match the real size yet — this is normal.
htu_006: Open Settings and enter the actual width of your phone screen (measure from the left edge to the right edge using a ruler).
htu_007: This setup only needs to be done once.
htu_010: Tap or drag to draw lines or shapes.
htu_011: When a shape is completed, the perimeter and area are calculated automatically.
htu_012: Spending even one minute per day counts as active usage during testing.
htu_013: Step 3. Prepare a Reference Photo (Optional, for Higher Accuracy)
htu_014: To measure real-world objects more accurately:
htu_015: Place a square rectangle like A4 paper on a table or wall.
htu_016: Take a photo showing the rectangle and save the photo to your gallery.
htu_017: Open the Red Eye page and tap '<' to open the Side Toolbars.
htu_018: Load the saved photo from your gallery.
htu_020: Draw the objects on the Blue Eye page at first and return to the Red Eye page.
htu_021: Create 4 points by tapping near the four corners of the reference object (such as an A4 sheet).
htu_025: Drag points to meet with four corners exactly.
htu_022: Enter the actual width and height of the rectangle in the input fields.
htu_027: Screen values (mm) are converted into real-world measurements (cm, mm, etc.). This is the core purpose of the app.
htu_211: After measuring the red reference rectangle in AR, calculate the blue painted area.
htu_212: You can also calculate white and light gray painted areas together.
htu_221: Use this when AR is unavailable, or when estimating dimensions later at the office.
htu_231: At a workshop beyond AR range
htu_311: Measure a table’s width on site (within AR range).
htu_img_312_alt: Measure a TV Monitor with AR
htu_312: Measure a TV’s screen width (within AR range).
